title: Earl Wheby
text:
Earl M. Wheby (December 12, 1915 – March 27, 2004) was an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> player and coach. He served as the head coach at the <a href="University%20of%20West%20Georgia">University of West Georgia</a> from 1946 to 1947.
He played college football at <a href="Georgia%20Tech">Georgia Tech</a> and played professionally for one season for the <a href="American%20Association%20%28American%20football%29">New York Yankees</a> of the <a href="American%20Association%20%28American%20football%29">American Association</a> in 1941
